root: ^This is the first poem that I ever memorized.  I must have been sixteen at the time.  I remember reading a lot of Dorothy Parker that year.  My friend Michael introduced me to her work, and  I credit him for much of my early understanding of poetry.  He also taught me to appreciate the nuances in different interpretations of Chopin's Nocturnes.
^Life before sixteen was a bit of a fog, but M. was one of the people who drew me out of it.
^Where the world and sky are one,
^I shall sit at home, and rock;
^Brew my tea, and snip my thread;
